column1: tossed up liberally on middle, no turn, blocked back to Hafeez on the front foot
slightly quicker and rolls on off, defended into the covers
nice and full just outside off, allows Khawaja to ease forward and drive a single to long-off
slides on middle stump, Warner now drives a single to long-off
hint of turn for Hafeez, Khawaja secures another single down to long-off
drags it short on middle, Warner skips back and short-arm jabs it along the ground to mid-on
puts it on a good length outside off and finds some outswing. Khawaja holds his bat up and lets it pass
much fuller and wider outside off, this one largely holds its line, ignored again
good length on off, tight line, defended back to Amir on the front foot
nice and full outside off, Khawaja is on the move as he taps it to cover. He searches for a quick single, it isn't there
overpitched and outside off, 138.4ks, driven on the up to extra-cover, where the fielder fumbles, allowing a single. Another single gifted to Australia
mid-off and mid-on are up now for the fast bowler, but Warner bisects them. Pretty full on a fourth-stump line, he moves forward and drives it well enough, ram-rod straight down the ground
slides on middle, no turn, Khawaja goes back and works a single to square leg
Warner goes on the attack. Flighted on middle stump, he steps away outside leg and drives it over cover. Inside-out strike. Good execution
dropped fractionally short and outside off, Warner now ventures deep in the crease and swats it away with the wrists to the left of midwicket
short ball on off, goes back and punches it to the right of Hafeez, he should have got to the ball. Pakistan need to tighten up in the field
very straight in line, flat, skips back and picks it off through square leg
full incoming ball, nudged behind square for one more
Khawaja shuffles across off and flicks it sweetly from off and middle through square leg. The length allowed Khawaja to go through with the stroke
good length and holds its line outside off, left alone
back of a length and on the stumps, stands up tall and punches to mid-on
and again! Khawaja moves across off stump again, picks off this full ball from off, no swing, and flicks this one through midwicket. Just three men on the leg side and Khawaja nails the gap
short and on leg stump, 139ks, hustles onto Khawaja. Skips back and ends up flapping a pull behind square on the leg side
short and on middle, Warner backs away and punches out to point
short of a length on off, Khawaja jumps and pushes it down to mid-on
short of a length and on off, Warner punches on the up, bounces on the batsman. Angles his bat and hits it between extra-cover and cover-point
Junaid needs to go fuller to give the ball a chance to swing. Short of a length and on middle, skips back and flays it away through the covers with great authority
much better. Fuller and outside off, slower ball at 115.6ks, Warner checks his push and plays up to cover
short again, Warner rocks back, and slaps it away to cover-point
back of a length and outside off, punched out to mid-off
Khawaja pre-meditates, walks across off, fetches this length ball and clips through backward square leg again

Warner launches the first six of the match. Pakistan's seamers have been too short today. Amir digs it outside off, Warner does not control the pull, but still sends the white ball flying into the stands beyond midwicket
length and outside off, tapped to cover
back of a length and outside off, goes back, opens the face, and punches it fine of backward point. Lovely placement to find the gap. Malik runs across in the deep and boots the ball in
short on off, fended back to the bowler
the ball is flying off Warner's bat. Fifty up for Australia, and Warner claims 34. Short and outside off, he nails a square-cut
back of a length on middle, keeps Warner honest now. Patted quietly to cover
length ball on middle, Warner blunts it with a straight bat
back of a length and on the stumps, pushed to wide mid-off for one
slower short ball outside off, Khawaja waits for it to arrive, swivels and then pulls to deep square leg
length and swings away wide outside off, reaches out, throws his bat at the ball and skews an outside edge to third man
full and straight, Warner opts to stay back and nudge to midwicket
back of a length and angling into a push back to the bowler
short and just a shade outside off, 142ks, angled in, stabbed back to the bowler
tight line on and around off, pushed to mid-off
full and angled in on off stump.  Push-driven straight down the ground, capitalising on the bowler's misfield, for a single
back of a length and angled in, tucks 'em up for room. But Warner manages to drop it in front of midwicket for a single
short of a length and too close to off for a cut. Warner ends up chopping back to Junaid off the inside half
full and angled into the pads, Warner turns it straight to midwicket and yells 'wait on'
Warner yells 'wait on' again, this is jabbed on the back foot to cover as it was back of a length and outside off
good length ball on off, Warner angles his bat and manipulates a single behind square on the off side with soft hands
Khawaja has been whipping from an off-stump line with ease today. Has plenty of time to pick this off through square leg
short and just outside off, punched into the covers. Just five runs off the last two overs. Pakistan need to build on this
nice and full outside off again, Khawaja happily walks across off and whips it away to deep midwicket. No swing at all for Pakistan's seamers
short and skids into the thigh as Warner jumps off his feet and misses the flick. Beaten for pace is Warner
length on middle and leg, tucks it in front of midwicket for one
back of a length on off, Khawaja's wristwork has been delightful today. Clipped to mid-on
opens the face, meets a back-of-a-length ball and dabs a single down to third man
length and outside off, driven on the up, hit back to the bowler
skips away to the boundary, so easy on the eye. Back of a length and outside off, stands up tall. Opens the face and punches delectably past backward point, beats third man too
dabbed away to the right of backward point again, third man runs across to his left to mop it up
overpitched on off, moves forward and drills a drive back to the bowler, Junaid sticks his right foot out. The ball hits the shin and pops up in front of cover
fractionally short and outside off, just 129.9ks, Khawaja has an age to step back and pull along the ground to deep square leg
dug short and outside off, even slower, 126ks, gentle pace. Pulled away easily to deep square again
back of a length and outside off, gets forward and pushes into the covers
full on middle, presses forward and pushes it into the off side
short on middle and leg, tucks it around the corner, in front of deep square leg
good length on the stumps, turned to midwicket
full and angling away outside off, square-driven to the right of sweeper on the off side

back of a length and angling away outside off, Warner opens the face and glides the ball fine enough of third man. Brings up his half-century off just 35 balls and takes in the applause. He hammered 113 and 55 in the SCG Test v Pakistan, he is now on his way towards another big one
whipped off the toes through midwicket was it was too full
loops it up on middle, full, driven down to long-on for a comfortable single
pushed through quicker on middle, for a change Warner dead-bats it
length ball, non-turning delivery on middle, defended with a straight bat to cover
uses his feet, meets a half-volley, and drives to long-on
dropped slightly short and outside off, goes back and cuts to sweeper
check-driven on the front foot to the right of extra cover.
clipped off the hips to deep midwicket
full on off, forward and driven firmly back to the bowler
full cutter, knocked to midwicket, change-up from Hasan Ali
length and angling across off stump, Khawaja crouches and chops it down to deep third man
back of a length, takes it from middle stump, opens the face, and steers it to point
Hasan rolls his fingers across another cutter, pops up off the track. Warner adjusts to the extra bounce and jabs it away to cover
tossed up liberally outside off, presses forward and crunches a drive straight to cover
full on middle, worked in front of square on the leg side
short, non-turning ball, moves back and cuts firmly to backward point
nudged off the pads in front of square again
picked off the pads behind square for one more
milked square on the leg side for one more as this was full and straight on middle.  No boundaries in the last 29 balls, but Australia are ticking the strike over impressively
very full on leg stump, near yorker, squeezed out to midwicket
front-foot n-ball. Full on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
Warner is caught at midwicket off a full-toss, but it's a free hit. Low full-toss on middle. Warner shovels it in the air to Imad Wasim
short and wide outside off, cracked on the back foot to sweeper cover
full and wide outside off, Khawaja drives nicely but can't beat Umar at backward point
veering into the pads, flicked away to square-ish long leg
slightly short and wide outside off cut away to deep point. Just one. No boundaries in the last 36 balls, including that front-foot no-ball. That free-hit should have been dispatched
full and outside off, driven to cover
dropped short and outside off, skips back and laces a cut straight to backward point
sliding into the pads, worked to backward square leg. 'Bowling Hafeez bhai is the cry from behind the stumps'
very full on middle and leg, driven to mid-on
angled full into the pads, nurdled wide of square leg for one
looped up on middle, Khawaja drives it to long-off for a single. That's drinks in Sydney
pitched up and outside off, opens the face and square-drives straight to point. Suddenly most shots are going to the fielders

Khawaja nicks behind, Rizwan dives across to his left and grasps the edge. 44 boundary-less balls, including the front-foot no-ball, and Pakistan find the breakthrough. Full and slanting away from off stump, Khawaja's front foot is nowhere close to the pitch of this delivery. He simply throws his bat at a big drive and edges it behind. Hasan Ali celebrates the wicket with a fist pump
full on off, whoa, those wrists! He whips it away to the right of midwicket and to the left of the square leg umpire. There comes the boundary for the hosts after 45 balls
good length and on a fourth-stump line, played back to the bowler with soft hands
full and nips back, inside-edges the flick onto the pad, the ball sneaks away behind square on the leg side
very full on off, driven to the left of extra cover, and to the right of mid-off
down the track, meets the pitch, and drives down the ground
slides on outside off, pushed back to the bowler
tossed outside off, driven down to long-on
uses his feet and drives a single down to long-off
bunted down to long-on for another single
slightly short and outside off. Warner rocks back and cuts, but there is a sweeper on the off side to cut it off
back of a length and swings into leg stump as Warner backs away, he is tucked up for room. Punched to cover
length and holds its line outside off, left alone
Smith shuffles across off stump. Full and swings away, Smith ignores it again
near yorker outside off, 133.4ks, Smith angles his bat and squeezes it out to third man
good length and tails in the air on leg, worked to midwicket
good length and slanting away outside off, Warner opens the bat-face and dabs it away towards point
full on the stumps, no turn, eased down to long-on
flighted on off stump, full, Warner presses forward and drives to midwicket
backs away, chops from middle stump to cover
back of a length on middle, Warner goes back and punches to cover
short and a hint of turn, Warner is right back, punching to point again. Warner's strike rate has dropped below 100
full and around off and middle, driven down the ground for one
Warner dances out, meets an inswinger, and shovels it in the air, does not carry to mid-on. The movement messes up with Warner's timing
overpitched and outside off, first boundary for Warner in 41 balls. He lunges forward and drives it on the up between mid-off and cover. Creamed it away
straying onto the hips, tucked away fine enough of long leg. Malik runs across to his left and boots the ball in
good length and angling across off, Smith secures a single down to third man by opening the bat-face

Rizwan goes up for a big caught-behind appeal, throwing the ball up in the air. Junaid joins in. No edge, no bat involved. Back of a length and straightens away outside off, well past the bat. Warner wafts and misses
back of a length and angled in, tucks the left-hander up for room. Squeezed to midwicket
full on the pads, pushed to midwicket
full, drifting into the pads, he gets down and sweeps it
dropped short on middle, waits for it, hangs back, and pulls aerially to the midwicket boundary
arm ball, good length, angling into the leg stump, defended off the back foot
drifted into the pad, pushed with soft hands  and into the open infield
good length on middle, goes back and this time he punches it firmly to long-on
back of a length, tailing in slightly from off stump, he punches it to deep cover. Slight hints of reverse here
short and wide, plays away from his body and tries to run it down to third man, inside edge through to the keeper
back of a length, angled across from off stump, shuffles across and defends to point off the back foot
dropped. Full and angled wide outside off, he chops at it and it flies to Sharjeel at knee height at backward point, and he's put in a lazy one hand out at this and put it down. Dismal effort.
goes for the yorker, misses his length and this is a full toss straight at Warner's mid-riff. Apologises straight away. Free hit
slower ball, back of a length outside off, steps out and drags it over mid-on
short outside off, cut to deep cover
pushed flat and full outside off, he pushes it to the left of Sharjeel at deep cover
pushed flat on middle, good length, goes back and tucks it into the leg side
drifted in full on middle, drives straight to midwicket off the thick inside edge
full on middle, this time he drives it to long-on
arm ball, dropped short on middle, pulled to deep square leg
drifted into the pads, gets down and hits the ball on top of its head as he sweep, it catches the left hand of short fine leg but crawls to the boundary anyway
good length, drifted in at middle, forward defence
drifted in full at middle, jams it out to long-off
flat on good length at middle stump, pushed to the right of deep square and they take on the fiedler's arm
back of a length on middle, driven down to long-on
full on off stump, driven to long-off, easy pickings
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot and doesn't connect the drive, but Azhar has let it through running in from midwicket and it's a single down to long-on
drifted into the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
pushes it flat at a good length on middle stump, goes on the back foot and glances it to deep square
drops short outside off, backs away, makes some room and slices it between backward point and short third man
81 kph, drifted slow on a good length at middle stump, no turn, uses the angle to push it through square leg
92 kph, pushed flatter, good length on middle, defended off the front foot
short on the pads, gets down on one knee and tries to slap it hard behind square but it hurries onto him and he inside edges to short fine
dropped short outside off, hangs back and slashes it through point
flighted nicely on off stump, driven down to long-on
flat, good length at middle, defends it back to the bowler
drops it short on middle, hurries back and nails the pull shot, but straight to deep midwicket
drifted full on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
drifted into the pads, Warner flicks and takes off for a run, but it's straight to the fielder at square leg and he's sent back
full, drifted down the leg, gets low, thinks about how good life is as he dispatches this sweep to the long leg boundary
pushed flat and into the pads, tries to tuck it away, but it gets him on the pads
back of a length outside off, pushed away nonchalantly despite the angle in and cover has to put in a slide after running backwards
good length on off, pushed to cover
full on the pads, goes forward and flicks it to deep square
good length on middle stump, makes room and cuts it to deep cover
oooh, good length, angling into him, but he stays glued to the crease and tries to push it through the off side. Gets a thick inside edge and fine leg keeps him to a single
good length, angled across from off stump, follows the line and defends it to point
he's shuffled across before Amir can deliver it. Amir persists with the angle, back of a length, driven to sweeper cover
full outside off, leans into the cover drive, gets it to the left of sweeper cover, takes off his helmet as he comes back for a second and puts in the trademark leap to celebrate his 12th ODI century
good length, angled across from outside off, left alone
shuffles across and waits to whip one into the leg side, gets it full outside off and is forced to defend
good length, angled across middle, makes room and slashes hard, beaten and it just misses the off stump
flat, good length on off stump, pushed to cover
good length, flat and on the pads, worked to the left of deep midwicket and runs the first one hard
good length, angled across from off, cut to sweeper cover
flighted outside off, driven straight to cover
good length on off stump, angled in, pushes it back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, pushed to point with soft hands
back of a length, angled across off stump, pushed to mid-off
yorker, starts on leg stump, tails into him and it raps him on the pad. He's fallen to the ground after attempting a flick
boom! We might see more of these now. Back of a length outside off, gets under it and slaps it to the midwicket boundary
good yorker, tails into him and he can only dig it out to square leg

big appeal and they've reviewed it slower ball, pitching on a good length at what looks like middle, he walks across the stumps and tries to turn it into the leg side, trapped in front of off stump. Amir was the only one appealing. Not out. That was close. No edge on it, pitched in line and deviated just enough to hit him marginally outside off, which means it's umpire's call
flat, full at middle, clears his front foot and squeezes it to the left of deep cover

Dropped! Back of a length on middle, goes back and tries to cream it to the right of Hasan Ali at mid-on, but he gets it high on the bat and it floats to him. He goes slowly, low to his right, and falls over as he tries to take it and it's down
short and wide, cut to deep cover
floated in on off stump, steps out and chips it over midwicket
floated outside off, goes for the reverse sweep, can't connect, top edge lands safely in front of short third man
short and wide, chopped to sweeper cover
short outside off, driven off the back foot to deep cover
good length slightly outside off, makes room and slaps it to deep cover
full outside off, takes a step across his stump and tries to thump it through the covers, but the bat turns and he hits it back to the bowler
good length outside off, stands his ground and flicks it  to deep square leg. There could also have been a cover drive from that line
yorker outside off, chopped to backward point
122 kph, rolls his fingers on this. Good length on middle, makes room to find the off side on the up, but it sits in the pitch and he gets a top edge over backward point
full on the pads, driven to long-on
back of a length on middle, shifts his weight back, lines up and pulls it over midwicket
good length on middle stump, flicks it into the leg side
drifted into the pads, uses his wrists to place it nicely to the right of midwicket and the left of deep square
good length on off, driven through the off side, cover puts in a dive but parries the ball further to his left and can't cut out the single. Unlucky.
short on off stump, thumped off the back foot to long-off. Reckless throw comes in and rolls down to fine leg, but Warner has run too far after grounding his bat and it's a single
good length on the pads, times this glance brilliantly and it flies to the square leg boundary
yorkey on off stump, bunted straight to midwicket
....so of course he goes now. Full and wide outside off, he's backed away too much and falls over as he reaches for this. Gets a thin nick that goes low to Riwan's left and he's pouched it
edged! Full and swings slightly away from outside off, he goes for the big cover drive and edges it through the third slip region

he's got him! Good length outside off, tails in, he walks across and is trapped in front. Smith reviews. No bat involved. That's out. Hits him in line and it would've crashed into middle and leg. What an over from Hasan Ali.
bang on the money. Swings in at off stump from a good length, Maxwell is happy to get behind it and defend back to the bowler
full on off stump, goes for the drive, hits it into the pitch and back to the bowler on the bounce
good length on middle stump, leans in and pushes it to long-on
good length, drifts into the pads, clipped to deep square
drifted wide outside off, full, driven to cover
good length, angled across the left-hander, pushed back to the bowler
good length outside off, pushed off the front foot to cover
132 kph, leg cutter wide outside off, throws his hands at it, beaten on the outside edge
full outside off, pushed to cover
oh geez! Dreadful shot. Good length, wide outside off, and I'm not even sure he knows where he wanted to hit this. Was still walking into it as he swung his bat at it. Well beaten.

139 kph, oh dear. It was lovely yorker, rapped him on  the pads and rolled to the right of slip, who has a needless shy at the stump. The bowler is walking back lazily and makes no attempt at stopping this, and it's four overthrows through mid-on
good length outside off, slight movement away, beats the outside edge as he tries to drive this
full on off stump, mistimed drive to mid-off
here we go. He lined up to switch before the bowler delviered. It was full on middle, he swiveled, turned into a leftie, and slapped it over the point boundary...that's point for the right-hander
full on the pads, driven down to long-on
good length, angled across the batsman, goes back and drives to long-on

dropped. Good length on middle, goes for the sweep, gets a top edge, Hasan Ali changes direction four or five times as he's running backwards from short fine and in the end can barely get a finger on it away from his body
full on the pads, driven to long-on
good length on middle, flicked to midwicket
good length, angled across off stump, tries to drag it into the leg side, thick inside edge to fine leg
good length, walks in towards the ball to force it through the off side, hits it back to the bowler and scrambles back to make his crease
good length on off stump, slower ball, clears his foot and tries to slog it over mid-on, but it keeps a little low and goes under his bat, drops in front of the keeper and he takes it on the bounce
good length, tailing in from off stump, goes for the slog again and the bat turns as he hits it to mid-on...whose throw hits the stumps. goes to the third umpire ...and he was safely in
full outside off, no feet, pushes it to the right of cover who gets across and puts in a nice dive
inswinging yorker at off stump, carves it out to deep cover
speared outside off, nearly 93ks, Head skips out, yorks himself and jams it back to Imad
slides across off stump, late-cut to short third man for a scampered single
no flight at all just fizzes through outside off, Maxwell now comes down the track, yorks himself and jabs the ball through the covers
Head skips out, Imad shortens his length outside off. Punched down past Maxwell's right to long-off
pinged straight over the bowler's head. Imad tosses it up outside off, angled in, plants his front leg forward and golf-swings it over Imad

one-bounce four. Maxwell pre-meditates, attempts a reverse-sweep and nails it. Full-toss outside the leg stump, Maxwell hits it over point. Imad went for the yorker, erred, and was punished by a reverse slog-sweep
full and slides on outside off, Head wafts and edges it onto the pad
Maxwell steps away outside leg, Hafeez follows the moving batsman with a full ball. Clipped away square through the leg side for two
opens the face and glides the ball through point
short of a length and angled in, punched down to long-on
Maxwell pre-meditates for a reverse-sweep. This is a waist-high full-toss outside leg. Dragged to midwicket rather than middled
dragged down outside off, allows Head to skip back and clobber it into the stands beyond midwicket
back of a length and skids on, 142ks, Maxwell attempts a fancy shovel-whip, and is rapped high on the thigh. Pitched outside leg, probably
Head backs away outside leg, Amir chases him with a shortish ball. Dragged behind square on the leg side off the inside half
wide yorker, Maxwell attempts to open the face and angle it away to third man. No dice. He can't touch it, just inside the guideline
very full on off stump, shovelled it away with the bottom hand to midwicket. Imad aims at the non-striker's end, and concedes an overthrow
full-toss on the leg stump, swiped away to the cow corner fence
Head backs away outside leg, this is a full-toss on off and middle, forced away to the covers
slower offcutter outside off, 116.7ks, Head slogs early, loses his shape, and does not make contact

low full-toss on off, belted back to Junaid with some force. Too harsh to call it a drop. Junaid was caught between taking evasive action and stopping the ball. He does a bit of both and saves three in the end
95ks, slower cutter outside off, pops up off the surface. Maxwell waits for the ball to arrive and upper-cuts towards third man
Head targets the short boundary on the leg side and smites a six. Short and outside off, slower one, unleashes a clean swing and sends the white ball flying over midwicket
very full and outside off, swerves back into the left-hander. He attempts another leg-side club and manages an inside edge onto the pad. The ball rolls away to the off side, adjacent to his boot

Dropped, Sharjeel is the culprit again. What are you doing Pakistan? Are you trying to out-Pakistan yourselves? Possibly a slower ball, full on middle and leg, Head miscues it in the air. Sharjeel lazily runs to his right from long-on. The ball pops in and pops out. The Pakistan fans in the stands can't believe it. Regulation catch
back of a length and outside off, Maxwell sinks his teeth into it and swings it nice and clean over the bowler's head. Bisecting mid-on and mid-off
Head moves away outside leg stump, this is short and following the batsman. Skied over midwicket to wide long-on

Azhar runs across to his left, dives to his left from mid-off, and only finger-tips this away. Amir is down on his knees. Poor, Amir. Poor, Pakistan bowlers. But this was a very difficult chance. Sliced away in the air and Head gets away
very full on the leg stump, shovelled away with the wrists to deep midwicket
Amir is seething. Short and outside off, jumps off the surface, 143ks, 'no problem' says Maxwell as he arches his back and ramps it to third man
full on middle and leg, near yorker, whipped through midwicket
full-toss on middle and leg, whipped away to deep midwicket
dragged short and outside off, Maxwell swats it away with a flat-bat, ends up toe-ending behind to Rizwan
length ball outside off, Head parcels it up and dispatches it several rows beyond the midwicket boundary. Smeared off the middle of the bat. Raises the 300 for Australia

Head is floored. Wide full ball outside off, reaches out and slices it away to short third man. Hasan Ali fires it miles over the head of Rizwan. Wild, wild throw. Horror fielding. Mickey Arthur can't watch this horror show. He covers up his face in his hands
yorker on leg stump, jammed out to square leg.
full and wide outside off, backs away and carves it through the covers
Head brings up the century stand and his fifty with one blow: smear over midwicket. Uses his feet, meets a short ball, and dumps it over the leg-side boundary

Phew, Pakistan finally hang onto a catch (yes, you read that right). Head pre-meditates, ventures a long way outside leg. He is chased by a short ball, which gets big. Attempts a hook and skies a top-edge to Malik at deep square leg
yorker on off, jammed out to mid-on
very full on the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket. They hustle back for the second
back of a length and on a fourth-stump line, punched back to Amir. He ends with 1 for 75
short and on middle, flat-bat swat to long-on
full and outside off, drilled down to long-off
short, rising ball on middle, Maxwell backs away outside leg and forehands it tennis-style past midwicket
full on off, swings hard and drags an inside edge to deep square leg
Maxwell pulls off another trick shot. Very full outside off, near yorker. Maxwell gives himself room, reaches out for the wide ball. Lifts it over cover with a slicing finish
Fifty for Maxwell too, off 34 balls. Back of a length, bunted to the right of Hasan for a couple
steps out, meets a full-toss, and carves it to sweeper
very full at the leg stump, half-volley, shovelled in the air over square leg. Very, very wristy
attempts a yorker outside off, comes out as a full-toss, which is punched to mid-off where Azhar fumbles now
yorker outside off, opens the face but does not make contact
wide yorker, Maxwell does well to reach out. He does even better to carve it away square through point
flays it away to the right of mid-off. Azhar dishes out a dive, if that's any consolation. Maxwell backs away outside leg, meets a full ball outside off and flat-bats it away with fierce power

Skied to long-on. Chest-high catch, Imad Wasim clings onto it.... just It nearly popped out at the last moment. Pitched up and outside off, right in the hitting slot. Wade lofts and miscues it to Imad. Fourth wicket for Hasan
Another mishap in the field. Malik now lets it through his legs to the long-on boundary. Short of a length, Maxwell, having shuffled around in the crease, swats it to long-on
banged in on middle and leg, flat-batted away to deep square leg
full and outside off, Maxwell pre-meditated, shuffling across off, and shovel-whipping it in the air fine of a diving short fine leg
very, very full on middle, Maxwell steps away outside leg and hoists it straight of mid-off. Don't bother chasing from long-on, Malik. Thuds into the straight boundary

Sharjeel hangs onto a dolly, and Hasan does the sajdah, celebrating his maiden five-for. His figures of 5 for 52 stand out amid this carnage. Very full and outside off, Maxwell flits around in the crease and shovel-whips it in the air. Sharjeel takes it at deep square leg. He did not even have to budge
back of a length on off, played back down the pitch
good-length inswinger, Azhar is stapled to the crease as he wafts an inside edge onto the pad
145.6ks yorker outside off, Azhar is beaten for pace. Late to jam his bat down
good length and angling away from off, not a half-volley, driven on the up between cover-point and extra-cover
148.8ks, full-toss, angled in and then swings away. Sharjeel is pinned to the crease as he outside-edges it past the two slips, and to the right of deep third man
very full and swings in on middle, 149.9ks, this is more convincing from Sharjeel. He does not move his feet much, but drives it straight of mid-off
nice and full outside off, pushed square towards point on the front foot

half-volley on the pads, Azhar shuffles across and puts it away to the square-leg boundary with a handsome flick, beats Starc's slide in the deep. He was in contact with the ball and ad boards at the same time, before tumbling outside the field of play
away-swinger, starts outside off and moves away further. Left alone
good length and angled in at off stump, swings away late,  Azhar is right forward to push it back to the bowler
very full outswinger, squeezed out to cover

Smith ventures to his left from second slip and gobbles the edge up in front of first slip. Nice and full, swings away outside off, Azhar follows the curve of the ball. Drives away from the body and nicks behind
very full and swings in at off, crease-bound drive to mid-on
short of a length on off, 144.4ks, Sharjeel jumps and fends to point
148ks, back of a length and outside off, short-armed away between mid-on and mid-wicket
full and outside off, 144ks, Sharjeel hits through the line, hits on the up, pumps it over the covers
dug short and outside off, 149ks, dragged to midwicket off the inside half
swinging full-toss on middle, Starc gets away as Sharjeel only pushes the ball to mid-on with no feet
floats a half-volley outside off, Azam moves forward, meets the pitch and creams a drive to the right of extra cover
full-length inswinger, worked to midwicket
good length and largely holds its line outside off, no shot offered
full and swings away outside off, snatches the outside edge and rolls down to third man
good length ball on middle, opens the face and runs the ball towards point
fractionally short and outside off, Sharjeel is stapled to the crease as he swishes and does not make contact
full, angling across off, swings away. Azam flashes a drive and sends an outside edge flying past the outstretched right hand of a leaping Smith at second slip
very full and outside off, opens the face and drives a single to short third man
full and slanted down leg, left alone by Sharjeel. Wide
nice and full on middle, 148.1ks, driven on the up, straight to Zampa at mid-off
short on the hips, 148.2ks, Sharjeel jumps back and pulls to Hazlewood at long leg
short of a length and angling across off, 144.6ks, Azam rises on top of the bounce and serenely punches to cover
pitched up and outside off, driveable length, Azam comes forward, gets close to the pitch, and strokes it to extra- cover
full and outside off, no lateral movement, Sharjeel swings it over mid-on who is inside the circle. Goes all the way
back of a length and outside off, Sharjeel responds with a scything drive to the left of backward point. Maxwell dives but can't make a clean save
short and bursts off the surface outside off, bounces over the attempted cut
short of a length and outside off, late-cut to third man
leg-stump ball, glanced to long leg
short and straying into the hips, Sharjeel picks it up and stylishly pulls it behind square
back of a length and angled in on off, played back to the bowler
just short of a good length and outside off, angled down to third man for one
short and kicks up at the thigh, Sharjeel aims to pull but is cramped up for room. Loses his shape, is surprised by the length and takes it on the body
shortish and outside off, Sharjeel whips it in the air, bounces in front of Head at deep backward square
back of a length and curves in, Azam inside-edges it near his foot
back of a length and outside off, loosens his wrists, and secures a single down to third man. 50 up for Pakistan in seven overs
good length and angled in on off, comes forward and drives the ball to mid-on
back of a length, zips away outside off extra bounce. Beats the outside edge. Azam gropes in the channel with no feet and misses
much wider outside off, attempted cross-seamer, but wobbles away. Left alone now
shot. Holds his pose and shows off his straight bat and poise. Length and outside off, not a half-volley, stands up tall and punchily drives it straight down the ground
full on off, gets across, picks it up and whips it away through backward square leg
edged away past the keeper. First slip could have gobbled that up. Full and Hazlewood runs this one across Sharjeel. He is pinned to the crease as he drives and gets away
just short of a good length, seams in, keeps low, and beats the inside edge
short of a length and angled in. Azam is up on his tippy toes as he punches the ball to mid-on

top-quality shot from Azam. He is really strong on the back foot. He was initially looking to come forward. Then seeing the short ball outside off he nimbly skips back and punches it handsomely to the left of backward point
much fuller and on the stumps, unfurls an on-drive to the left of mid-on
full and angled in on off, lovely wristwork from Azam again. Flicked away in the gap between midwicket and mid-on
slower short ball cuts away from Sharjeel. He throws his bat at it and is beaten by the lack of pace
darted into the pads, clipped away past Maxwell's dive at square leg
length ball on off stump, whipped away on the back foot to deep midwicket
non-turning ball on middle, played back to the bowler
tossed up on middle, plays well in front of the body to the leg side
full on middle, eases forward and flicks it to short midwicket, Smith dives to his left and shows Pakistan how its done
this is worked away more or less straight to Smith at short midwicket
short on middle, Sharjeel hops and chops the ball to point
bail-high short ball on off, swat-pulled away to long leg
lifter outside off, Azam evades it by slipping under
short and wide outside off, chopped away to backward point
good length on middle, chips a drive down the ground, mid-on (Zampa) dives to his left and makes a smart stop

147.1ks short ball, throat-high short ball, the extra pace and bounce catches Azam unawares. He is caught between hooking and ducking. Ends up doing this and that, and sends a top-edge fluttering to the right of midwicket
straight in line, tapped to leg
slightly short on off, Sharjeel camps back and punches the ball to long-on
skips down the track, meets the pitch and drives it down to long-on for one
dropped short and wide outside off, cut away on the back foot, Warner attacks the ball at deep point
speared at the pads, whipped away to square leg
slower through the air on middle, tip-and-run single to cover
very full ball on middle stump, Azam stays leg side of the ball and pushes to long-off
Sharjeel plays for turn, this slides across the face, and beats him neck and crop
slower through the air on middle, blocked to midwicket
straight ball on middle, rolls on. Sharjeel inches forward and plays it back to the bowler
bail-high short ball on leg stump, not too short, rocks back and nails a pull in front of square, to the left of Warner at deep midwicket
slides on middle, excellent running. Pakistan are listening. Drops it in front of cover and sets off
good length and outside off, pushed to Maxwell at square point on the front foot
worked away down the pitch to the left of Head
Sharjeel dumps Head over wide long-on. Runs down the track, gets close enough to the pitch, and hits against the spin. The ball lands in a stand filled with Pakistan supporters
down the track and tapped down the ground
Azam now uses his feet, manufactures a very full ball and turns it straight to square leg

Azam holes out to long-on running to his right. Good catch from Hazlewood. That's the major difference  between the two teams. Good length and outside off, Azam drops down to one knee, attempts a slog-sweep, and skies it to Hazlewood. The bat twisted in Azam's hands, sucking all the power from the shot
tossed up and spins in on middle, Sharjeel bunts it to long-on and brings up a 36-ball fifty
short legbreak outside off, punched through cover
leg-side wide
Head attacks the ball from deep midwicket, the ball just drops in front of him, and rolls away to the fence. Dropped fraction short and outside off, pulled away
low full-toss on middle, Sharjeel backs away outside leg and plays a economical push-drive, beats extra cover to his left and mid-off to his right
full on middle, driven along the ground straight to mid-off
Zampa hangs it up in the air on middle, no much turn, dead-batted to the off side
full and outside off, eased square through point
Sharjeel launches this short ball into the top-tier beyond midwicket. Slightly short and outside off, skips back and pulls it away with immense power
slides on outside off, Sharjeel flashes and sends an outside edge fine of short third man. Six followed by four
edged away fine of short third man again. Offbreak, turns away outside off, flashes and gets three successive boundaries
knocked off the pads through square leg. Played with soft hands
slides across off, pushed to mid-off, who is hanging back, for a single
short legbreak outside off, rushes onto the batsman, who initially thought about pulling. Shelves it at the last moment and flat-bats it down the ground
full and slides on straight, chipped into the midwicket region
another bail-high short ball, which is swatted on the back foot to deep square leg
full, no turn on off, forward and driven past the left hand of long-off

Sharjeel can't clear the long boundary, Warner snaps it up at the edge of the deep midwicket boundary. He lets out a big roar. Tossed up outside off, not much turn. Sharjeel goes down on one knee. Toe-ends a slog sweep. First wicket for Zampa, and that's a major blow for Pakistan
good length on off stump, spins away slightly, punched off the back foot to deep cover
pushed flat, good length at middle stump, around the wicket, goes back and tucks it to deep square
dropped short on middle stump, connects the pull shot nicely but Warner gets across and keeps it down to one at deep square
short on off stump, makes room and slices it to short third man
full on middle, driven down to long-on
full outside off, pushed to cover
good length on the pads, glanced off the hips to square leg
good length outside off, goes straight through, driven off the back foot to sweeper cover
got plenty on this! Clean hit. Floated on a good length at middle, gets a knee down and hits a fluent slog sweep to clear the deep fielder
full toss on the pads, goes for the flick and misses, it catches his boot and balloons up. Wade catches and appeals, not out, no review
flighted full on off stump, driven down to long-off
full on off stump, drives it back to the bowler who fumbles, but it doesn't go too far
full on the pads, flicked down to long leg
good length, goes straight through on the angle across middle stump, punched to deep square leg
wide outside off, he leans in and reaches out to square drive, it goes aerially and just eludes short third man
good length on off stump, pushes off the front foot and gets a thick outside edge
full on off stump, driven to cover
good length on off, uses soft hands and a front foot stride to drop it in front of short third man
good length, floated on the pads, flicks it uppishly to midwicket
shot! Full delivery on off stump, gets in balance and times the straight drive beautifully
good length on off stump, gets forward and gets good timing on his push to mid-off
back of a length on middle, climbs on his toes and pushes it to mid-on's right
good length on off, puts a short stride in and pushes it past cover
good length, angled across from the corridor, left alone
back of a length on off stump, punched off the back foot to point
good length on middle, hurries back and nails the pull shot straight to Warner at deep square
tossed up on the pads, steps out and drives to long-on
good length on middle, steps out and gets beaten in flight, gets a thigh guard on it
fired in flat and full on the pads, flicked straight to square leg
good length on middle, steps out and pushes it to midwicket
short and wide, cut away to deep cover
good length outside off, driven on the up to deep cover
slower ball, good length on off stump, tries to push it in front of point for a single, sent back
another slower ball. Short and wide this time, he goes for the cut, but the bat turns in his hands because of the pace. Still manages to get it past cover for four
back of a length on middle, swivels and hooks it to deep square
yorker outside off, slices it down to third man
back of a length in the corridor, opens the face but point gets across to save the single
good length on the pads, goes back and whips it to deep midwicket
back of a length on middle, driven off the back foot to long-on
full on off stump, goes forward and turns it down to long-on
floated in on leg stump, gets low and paddles it fine, Cummins gets across quickly
good length on the pads, whipped off the pads to fine leg
JUST clears mid-off. Good length on middle steps out and can't get to the pitch. He goes through with the shot and just about clears the fielder there
good length on off stump, driven uppishly to mid-off
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot. Cross-seam delivery
back of a length, angled into the batsman, leans back and chops it down to third man
back of a length, angling in from off stump, flicked to deep square
good length on off stump, pushed to point
good length on off stump, pegs him back and he gets a leading edge as he tries to turn it into the leg side
good length outside off, chopped to short third man off the back foot
good length on middle, backs away and cuts it straight to point, risky shot
this one turns from off stump, but he's cut it to point again
full on off stump, jams it out to cover
good length on off stump, pushes forward and drives to long-off
good length on leg stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length, angles into the batsman, who jumps up and glances it to deep square

mix-up. Might have been out with the direct hit. Back of a length on off, he pushes it towards point, takes off, then says no, and Malik has to scramble at the non-striker's as Maxwell has a shy and misses
slower ball, good length at off stump, turned down to third man off the front foot
good length, angled in from middle, tries to drive this but gets it on the bottom and deep midwicket gets across
144 kph, bouncer aimed at his chest, he gets well under it
short and wide, slashes hard and his bat goes behind his head in the follow-through. Really powered that through point
short and wide, goes for the cut and is beaten on the outside edge
good length on off stump, pushed square into the off side
back of a length outside off, it's a googly that spins in slightly, he places his late cut straight to short third man
good length outside off, pushed to backward point
short and wide, cut to deep cover
slightly fuller and pushed through this time, tries the late cut but is beaten
good length, angling in at off stump, hurries back and across and tries to run it down to third man, but he's cramped and pushes it straight to point
slower ball, back of a length outside off, slapped to deep cover
slower ball outside off, comes in at waist height and he opens the face to run it down to third man
full and angled into the pads, flicked to the left of fine leg
147 kph, full and straight at the stumps, driven without any timing to mid-off
drifted full towards off stump, goes low and sweeps it down to fine leg
full on off stump, gets to the pitch and hits it nicely inside-out, but can't place it. Long-off gets across and takes it on the bounce
pushed flat and straight, goes for the full, no connection on this whatseover and it crawls to midwicket
good length on off, spins slightly and he can't middle his cut
good length outside off, pushed to point's right

floated in on a good length outside off, Hafeez gets slow and goes for the slog sweep, it climbs on him slightly and takes the top of the bat and carries easily to deep midwicket on that long boundary
good length on off, goes forward and defends straight to cover
good length outside off, nips back in and he defends it to point
good length, nipsback in from outside off, pushed with soft hands to midwicket's right
back of a length, cramps him as he tries to run it down to third man, goes straight to point
good length on off stump, opens his face and tries to run it down again, Maxwell gets across, has a shy and hits the stump, but it deflects off it and they give away a run
back of a length outside off, pushed to point
slider, good length at middle stump, makes room and punches it to the sweeper
good length outside off, goes down the track and drives it on the up to long-off
flighted and full on off stump, makes room and drives it to sweeper
full on middle and leg, tries to drive it through the off side, thick inside edge to short fine
good length on off, turns away slightly, driven on the up to sweeper cover
googly, pitches on middle, catches him on the pads and drops into the off side, they get across for a run. There was an appeal but it's not out.
full on middle stump, driven straight to mid-on
good length, angling into the pads, glanced down to fine leg
back of a length on off stump, makes room and heaves it into the leg side. No balance or shape there, that's the pressure playing a shot. Warner gets across to his left from deep square
back of a length outside off, tries to stab it to third man,beaten on the outside edge
good length on off, angled bat, down to third man

how has Akmal survived that? Good length, nips back in from outside off, he's had a wild swipe across the line and it's missed the inside edge and the off stump as it goes through low to a diving Wade's left
flighted on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length on off stump, back foot punch to long-off
good length pitching outside leg, steps out and pushes it to deep square leg's left
flighted on the pads, turned off the front foot to square leg

good length, down the leg side, throws his bat at it with a sweep and gets it fine. Starc gets across, fumbles after sliding and fires it in - would've been run out by a long way with a direct hit. Wade doesn't collect it cleanly, poor keeping.
good length on middle, pushed to square leg off the back foot
good length on off stump, pushed down to third man
dropped! good length on middle, swipes across the line again but it's too full for a pull. Balloon up towards Khawaja who mistimes his jump completely
dropped again! Full on middle stump, tries to slog this away, doesn't connect, Head runs in from long-on, tries to take it low while leaning forward and spills it
good length on off stump, pushed off the front foot into the off side
good length outside off, walks across to flick it into the leg side, cops it on the thigh guard
good length, angled in at off stump, tries to drop it into the off side, but Maxwell runs in quickly from point. That shot is not working for him.
slides across off, driven to the covers
leg-stump short ball, moves back and pulls in the air over backward square
much quicker and flatter down leg, Malik looks to sweep, ends up ticking it fine on the leg side, wide enough of the keeper
Malik sees some flight, he dashes down the track, meets the pitch. Gets under it and sends it flying over Maxwell at long-on

Warner simply loves the SCG. He runs in from deep midwicket, attacks the ball, and pockets a low catch. Excellent judgement. He then turns back towards the crowd, lets out a roar, and thumps his chest. He enjoyed that catch. That's how you do it, Pakistan. Pushed through outside off, Malik drops to one knee and skies a slog-sweep. Only toe-ended it in the air...
tossed on the leg stump, knocked through square leg
123.3ks, slower ball on middle, poked back to the bowler. Starc loses his footing and collapses in his followthrough
very full and angling across off, drives away from the body and slices it to backward point
pinpoint yorker on off stump, Umar jams his bat down on the ball in the nick of time
slower bouncer on middle stump, bursts off the surface, sails over the attempted hook. Wide called. Too high
Umar shimmies out and puts Starc off. Slides a full ball down the leg side

Pat Cummins calmly settles under the skier. Two wickets in two overs right after drinks. Starc digs it short and outside off. Slower bouncer. Umar has a limp pull at it, plays way early, and top-edges it into the hands of Cummins at short fine leg. Umar never really got going
back of a length and on the leg stump, misses the flick, grazes the pad and rolls to square leg
low full-toss, slanted in on off, pushed to mid-off
steps out, gets a short ball and flat-bats it to deep backward point
back of a length and bounces over the attempted punch
back of a length and outside off, succeeds in punching through backward point now
tennis ball bounce, short of a length and outside off, Rizwan pulls early and misses. Slower cutter. Rizwan under-edges it, but does not carry to Wade diving forward
yorker, tails in on middle and leg squeezed out to midwicket
short and Rizwan jumps onto the width outside off, lashing a back-foot cut to the square third man fence
yorker outside off, sliced away to backward point
full and slanting into the pads, clipped away square through the leg side
full and outside off from around the wicket, holds its line, driven to cover
pitched up and outside off, carved away to sweeper. You can't take on Warner's arm. Just a single
yorker on middle, driven to mid-off
wide of the crease and angled into a hurried push to cover
bail-high short ball on middle, slower one, Imad waits for it to arrive and pulls the offcutter square of short fine leg
full cutter outside off, grips in the surface, carved over wide mid-off
length and outside off, Imad camps back and  bashes it to sweeper cover
back of a length on middle, punched back past the bowler's outstretched right hand, but Zampa at mid-on flings himself to his left to stop the ball

short cutter outside off, 114ks, swatted away with a flat-bat to backward point. Maxwell throws at the bowler's end, no backing up from Cummins, Khawaja can't collect it, Head can't collect either at the boundary, despite a desperate slide. Maxwell has a wry smile, Smith is annoyed with the throw. The ball trickles away to the fence
tossed up liberally outside off, donkey drop, Imad eyes the leg side and scoops a leading edge in front of cover
Rizwan aims a slog-sweep, the ball goes only as far as midwicket. And another overthrow conceded by Australia

quick skidder from Zampa, fizzes in with the arm, beats the inside edge as Rizwan plays across the line and is pinged on the front pad above the knee-roll. The finger goes up. Nothing on Hotspot. Nothing on RTS. The tracker shows it would carry onto hit the top of leg stump. Umpire Gaffney's on-field call is vindicated. Rizwan's review in vain
wrong'un, pitches outside leg, worked to leg
hung up outside off, eased to long-off
slides on outside off, beats the outside edge. Wade gathers the ball and flicks the bails off. Appeals for a stumping, but Amir grounds his back foot in time
Imad shuffles a long way across off, instead of targetting the stumps Cummins follows the batsman. Deflected behind square
offcutter, shoots low outside off, and sneaks under the bat
shortish and outside off, skips back and crashes it to the cover boundary
Amir backs away outside leg stump, slashes and misses outside off
back of a length and outside off, 141ks, Amir, having backed away, slashes again, this time edging it behind to Wade at a comfortable height
very full on middle, 142ks, nudged through midwicket
donkey drop from Zampa, tossed-up wrong'un, spins in, bursts through the gate, tantalisngly misses the off stump, and Wade misses the stumping. He did not even attempt it
quick change-up. Fast and flat on middle, hit down the ground
Imad reverse-sweeps it, top-edges it, eludes the reach of a diving Cummins at point
googly, sits back and whips through midwicket for two
skids on middle and leg, poked to midwicket
another googly, slower and spins in, pulled over square leg on the back foot
full and angled in, defended back down the pitch to mid-on, Cummins runs in, he is too eager to grab the ball and throw it onto the stumps. Does not collect cleanly
full and just outside off, scooped in the air to the left of extra cover
length ball on off, opens the face and taps through point

Imad shuffles a long way across the off stump, Hazlewood follows him with a very full ball. Imad aims to scoop it away over the keeper. Does not get enough bat on ball and ends up tickling a catch behind to Wade
Australia beat Pakistan by 86 runs and sew up the series. Junaid bags a first-ball duck. Full and swerves in slightly, breaches Junaid's defences and hits the off stump
